title: Bosnia’s Foreign Envoy Annuls Serb Law Seen as Separatist Move
description: Bosnia-Herzegovina’s international overseer revoked two laws adopted by ethnic Serbs as unconstitutional, the latest standoff threatening stability in the country’s fragile postwar balance.

title: Trump Praises Supreme Court Decisions at Rally in South Carolina
description: Donald Trump praised Supreme Court rulings that ended affirmative action in college admissions and a student debt-relief program, as well as limited LGBTQ protections, touting his role in installing the court’s conservative majority as he campaigned in South Carolina on Saturday.

title: China Says New Ambassador to US Met Biden at White House
description: President Joe Biden received China’s new ambassador to the US at the White House, the Chinese Embassy in Washington said in a statement, the latest in a series of meetings between officials of the two largest economies to normalize strained ties.

title: Truss to Convene Taskforce to Tackle Slumping Global Growth
description: Liz Truss is set to launch a new taskforce of economists aimed at finding solutions to sluggish growth in the West.

title: Figures Show Growing Number of Staff Leaving the NHS in England
description: A record number of staff left their jobs the NHS in England last year, reports suggest.

title: Macron Scraps German Trip as France Braces for More Violence
description: President Emmanuel Macron postponed a long-planned state visit to Germany as France braces for a potential fifth night of riots and looting triggered by the police killing of a teenager.

title: South Africa to Add 3% to Salaries of All Public Office Bearers
description: South Africa President Cyril Ramaphosa has signed off on a 3% increase in the salaries of all public office bearers, according to a statement from the presidency.

title: The Supreme Court Just Gave Democrats a New 2024 Rallying Cry
description: Before last year’s midterms, the Supreme Court’s decision to strike down the right to an abortion galvanized Democrats. History may be repeating itself.

title: Dutch King Apologizes for Country’s Role in Slave Trade
description: King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands apologized for the Dutch role in the slave trade in a move that could set a new precedent for the royal families of Europe’s former colonial powers.

title: Just Stop Oil Protesters Disrupt London Pride Over ‘High-Polluting’ Sponsors
description: Just Stop Oil protesters have disrupted London's Pride march in protest over the parade accepting sponsorship money from "high-polluting industries".

title: Macron Postpones State Visit to Germany as Riots Rock France
description: French President Emmanuel Macron postponed a long-anticipated trip to Germany amid violent unrest at home triggered by the police killing of a 17-year-old boy, a further sign the tense domestic situation is encroaching on his international agenda.

title: Biden to Discuss NATO Membership in Meeting With Swedish Premier
description: President Joe Biden will discuss security cooperation when he hosts Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson at the White House on Wednesday, according to a statement from his office.

title: Supreme Court Roils US Colleges With One-Two Punch on Race, Debt
description: With two landmark decisions in just over 24 hours, the US Supreme Court could reshape higher education.

title: Russian Mutiny Fallout, Key Supreme Court Rulings: Weekend Reads
description: Vladimir Putin’s efforts to reassert his control a week after an abortive uprising by a mercenary chief shook his authority are showing strains, with infighting spreading in the security establishment as the Russian president moves on senior players thought to have supported the mutiny.

title: Sunak’s Struggles, Water Woes and Pride: Saturday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter.

title: East Timor’s Independence Hero Gusmao Returns to Power as PM
description: DILI, East Timor (AP) — Former East Timor independence fighter Xanana Gusmao was sworn in on Saturday as prime minister of Asia’s youngest country after his party won the parliamentary election in May.

title: Just Stop Oil Threatens to Disrupt London Pride Over ‘High-Polluting’ Sponsors
description: Just Stop Oil has threatened to disrupt London's Pride march if the parade does not stop accepting sponsorship money from "high-polluting industries".

title: China Names New PBOC Party Chief, Sets Stage for Governor Change
description: China named Pan Gongsheng as the central bank’s new Communist Party chief, putting him in line to be the next governor.

title: France Surveys Damage From Days of Riots Ahead of Teen’s Funeral
description: France is surveying the damage from a fourth night of street violence ahead of the funeral Saturday of the teenaged boy whose killing by police triggered a wave of anger and riots.

title: Ukraine Recap: CIA Chief Called Russia After Mutiny, WSJ Says
description: CIA Director William Burns called his Russian counterpart to say the US had no involvement in the failed mutiny by Wagner Group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing officials familiar with the matter. The call with Sergei Naryshkin, head of Russia’s foreign-intelligence service, is believed to be the highest-level contact between the governments since the attempted uprising a week ago. Burns also made a previously unreported trip to Kyiv in June for meetings with to

title: De Beers Reaches Last-Minute Deal With Botswana on Diamond Sales
description: De Beers reached an agreement in principle to keep selling rough diamonds from Botswana for another decade, securing the crucial partnership after years of tense negotiations just as the latest deadline for a deal expired.

title: Riots in France Stretch Into a Fifth Night After Police Killing
description: NANTERRE, France (AP) — Hushed and visibly anguished, hundreds of mourners from France’s Islamic community formed a solemn procession from a mosque to a hillside cemetery on Saturday to bury a 17-year-old whose killing by police has triggered days of rioting and looting across the nation.

title: Sunak Shows Frustration as Torrid June Has UK Cabinet on Edge
description: In a Downing Street office last week, under the glare of chandeliers and a big television screen, a flash of frustration burst across Rishi Sunak’s face during a conference call.

title: Supreme Court Flexes Conservative Muscles in Term’s Final Days
description: The US Supreme Court waited until the end of its nine-month term to remind the country just how much muscle its 6-3 conservative majority has.

title: Russia’s Rusty Oil Tanker Fleet Sets Sail With Newer Ships
description: An armada of tankers ferrying sanctioned oil around the globe is starting to get younger, bucking a months-long trend of using the world’s oldest and most dangerous vessels.
